page.title: 08TRANSPORT IN SOUTH TYNESIDE
page.content: In Jarrow there is an important Bus terminal.Most buses which travel through the town go to the bus station.However,the Metro is the most important transport system in South Tyneside.The taxi ranks and the bus station are beside the Metro station.Metros are the quickest means of getting around Tyneside.Buses cost the same but take much longer.There are two buses which go through the Tyne Tunnel.They are the 310 and 319 services.The 310 goes to Blyth from Sunderland via Jarrow and the 319 goes to Cramlington from Sunderland via Jarrow.The Metro System is the most regular means of transport,calling at Metro stations in South Tyneside every ten minutes
